abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Liberian
            Infrastructure Rehabilitation Project (LIRP), is to provide
            the Government with emergency support to restore priority
            infrastructure in the Port of Monrovia and at Roberts
            International Airport and assist the Government in
            developing a medium-term strategic framework for
            rehabilitating the port and aviation sectors. Negative
            measures include: air pollution, noise pollution, water
            pollution, solid waste generation, and impacts on flora and
            fauna. Mitigation measures include:  (a) use of good quality
            fuel and lubricants; (b) prevention of dust through
            sprinkling during periods of dry season; (c) noise
            prevention measures, such as mufflers, installed on vehicles
            and equipment; (d) tanks for fuel storages should be leak
            proof and installed in a bunded area, fuel storage tanks
            shall be checked daily, and in case of leakage will be
            replaced until repaired; (e) excavated soils should be
            reused as much as possible as filling material, and
            contaminated soil should be considered as waste material and
            disposed of accordingly. Excess soil should be disposed off
            at sites approved by the municipality; and (f) the
            contractor should minimize the destruction of flora and
            limit the working area to prevent unnecessary ecological damages.
